ADMINISTRATION.—

NOTIFICATION.—Not later than the date which is 4 months prior to the closure of a coal mine or coal power plant, the operator of such mine or plant shall provide notice to the Secretary with respect to such closure, including such information as is deemed necessary by the Secretary to determine the eligibility of any former employee of such mine or plant for any benefits provided under this section, as well as the amount of such benefits.
CLOSURE.—For purposes of this section, the term ‘‘closure’’ means—
with respect to any coal mine, any reduction in production occurring after the date of enactment of this Act which is accompanied by permanent layoffs; and
with respect to any coal power plant, the permanent closure of 1 or more generating units occurring after the date of enactment of this Act which is accompanied by permanent layoffs.
QUALIFIED INDIVIDUAL.—For purposes of this section, the term ‘‘qualified individual’’ means any individual—
whose employment was terminated as the result of the closure of 1 or more coal mines or coal power plants;
who, prior to such closure, was continually employed at 1 or more such mines or plants—
for a period of not less than 12 months, and
for an average of not less than 35 hours a week during the 12-month period preceding such closure; and
for whom the applicable information has been provided to the Secretary pursuant to paragraph (1).
